register-view.title: Hello!
register-view.subtitle: Please enter details to create an account!
register-view.requirements:
A username is valid, if:
- It starts with a letter
- it only contains characters, numbers or an underscore
- it is not shorter than 3 letters, not longer than 30 characters

A password is valid, if:
- it has 6 characters
- it contains at least one digit
- it contains at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter and one special character

errors.provided_credentials_wrong:
Please provide valid credentials!
 Valid passwords: at least 6 characters, contain an uppercase, a lowercase letter, a number, min. one special character, e.g. Test01&
errors.other: An unexpected error occured. Potentially server is down.
An unexpected error occured. Potentially server is down.

experimentCreate.logicHint: Subspace Logic consists of two parts 1. Subspaces: For example [0, 2, 4] describes all outliers of the subspace containing the columns with indices 0, 2 and 4 2. Operators: For example [0, 2] and [2, 3] describes all outliers in both the first and the second subspaces (available: and, or) When using both operators you need to use parenthesis to define the order in which the operators are applied For example ([0, 1] and [1, 2]) or [3, 4] If you combine more than two subspaces with the same operation, parenthesis are not needed. For example you can write [0, 1] and [1, 2] and [3, 4] It is recommended to not add unnecessary parenthesis for slightly better performance Some examples [0, 1, 2] or [1, 2] [0, 1] ([0, 1] and [1, 2]) or ([2, 3] and [3, 4] and [4, 5])
experimentCreate.paramHint:
empty field --> default value is used,
red border --> invalid input type,
blue border --> parameter is not optional and needs a value,
gray border --> type is allowed but can still be incorrect
